moves.2. Nf3: now  he expected boring Petrov defence,but he met oneone of most stunning  attacks in chess
moves.2... f5: BAMM! The Latvian make blood and violence on board.Now my opponent  cannot avoid ultra sharp game where draw is impossible.
moves.3. Bc4: His main opening was Italian game, so he develop in this style.
moves.3... fxe4 4. Nxe5 Qg5: This is the poisoned pawn variation of Latvian gambit the sharpest opening ever!
moves.5. Nf7: My opponent wasn't familiar with Latvian gambit made natural but bad move.better is 5d4 Qxg2 6Qh5+ g6 7Bxg6 Qxh1+ 8Ke2 with extreme complicated position
moves.5... Qxg2 6. Rf1 Nf6 7. Nxh8 d5 8. Be2: the other bishop moves  allow  bg4
moves.8... Bh3 9. d3 Qxh2 10. dxe4: bad mistake that allowing crushing attack
moves.10... Bc5 11. Be3: even worse since open the white king
moves.13... Qg3+ 14. Kd2 Nxe4+ 15. Kc1 Qxe3+ 1: the black attack is too strong
moves.21. Nxd8 Nf3: There is dark storm over white king
moves.22. b3 Nxd2 23. Qg1: Now black knights make killing blow
moves.25. Qxe3: 25cxd3 can"t  save white  Qxg1 26Kc2 Qh2+! with mating attack
moves.25... Na3#: This two knight mate is so nice finish on hard tournament

gameName: Crushing 1e4 with Latvian Gambit and two knights mate!
